page.title: 06 JOYCE GREEN HOSPITAL
page.content: In 1901 two tempory hospitals were built, the Long Reach hospital which had 300 beds and the Orchard hospital which had 800 beds. They were opened up because of the small pox emergency at that time. On 28th December 1903 Joyce Green Hospital was opened incase there was another emergency for infectious diseases as there had been. The Long Reach Hospital was completely rebuilt as a permanent hospital in 1928. Joyce Green then became an ordinary hospital taking in many kinds of diseases. The Orchard hospital was then handed over to the goverment in 1915 as a military hospital. Ther was strong local feeling about the hospitals as to the risk of infection to the town. Joyce Green is however still serving a large part of the community today.
